description: From Middle English punishement, from Old French punissement, from punir (“to punish”). Equivalent to punish +‎ -ment. Displaced native Old English wīte.

entries.meaning: The act or process of punishing, imposing and/or applying a sanction.
examples: The naughty children were given a punishment by their teachers.

entries.meaning: A penalty to punish wrongdoing, especially for crime.
A suffering by pain or loss imposed as retribution
(figuratively) Any harsh treatment or experience; rough handling.
examples: a vehicle that can take a lot of punishment
